project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We developed a company-wide project creation template, which creates a Permission Schema and shares that schema among any projects created through it. The project template implements AddProjectHook interface, registered as project-blueprint in atlassian-pligin.xml.

Greenhopper/Agile has registered com.atlassian.greenhopper.project.PermissionSchemeProjectCreateHandler as an implementation of com.atlassian.jira.project.ProjectCreateHandler.
That handler unconditionally replaces with the "Software Permission Schema" the Permission Schema of any software project, which is not a copy of another project. 

This logic overwrites the permission schema our project template sets in any newly created projects.
fields.summary: Agile/Greenhopper Project Create Handler overrides Permission Schema of project created through (custom) template

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

#  When you go into {{Project Administration > Releases > Manage Versions}}, you have the option to either "Release" or "Build and Release". The release button will only perform the release without any Bamboo action. The build and release will attempt to access Bamboo for the build as well.
# When you go into {{Project > Releases > Release}}, if there is an application link, the Release button will attempt to perform the "Build and Release" option from the path above. If there is no application link, it will simply perform the release option.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add an additional button to this {{Project > Releases > Release}} path that will serve for the "Build and Release" option and leave the "Release" button for the JIRA release only. This will allow for users without Bamboo access to still be able to release, instead of being prompted to login to the other application.
fields.summary: JIRA Release asks for Bamboo authentication

fields.description:
It would be great if we could configure a warning popup, if the user tries to add a Story/Issue to a planned/ongoing Sprint, when the Story is not in a certain status. 

Agile/Scrum Teams often use a "Definition of Ready" gateway to take stories for the next sprint. We have a configured a dedicated workflow step, a status called "Ready for Implementation" for this. When reaching this status, the workflow ensures that all relevant fields were filled before. We would like to prevent users, from adding Issues to a sprint container, which are not in this Status.

Currently, they can also add Issues in status "Open" to a sprint. Of course we could change the board filter, to display only Issues in Status "Ready for Implementation" on the Backlog. But we really like the Idea of a groomed and ranked Backlog, with the READY items on top and the rough ideas at the bottom.
fields.summary: Backlog: Prevent Stories from being added to a sprint which are not READY

h3. Problem Definition
Anonymous users can no longer view JIRA Agile gadgets in Confluence pages post-JIRA7.0, due to Agile functionality now require the JIRA Software application access. 
The error on the gadget:
{code}
{"errorMessages":["You currently don't have access to perform this operation."],"errors":{}}
{code}
Screenshot:
!AgileGadget.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Not sure whats the best step here as anonymous users can at best view the project, but none of its JIRA Agile functionality would be available.  This is intended behaviour because of the introduction of [application access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-application-access-744721629.html] to replace the functionality of the *JIRA Users* global permission in JIRA 7. 
We could allow just the REST calls for these gadgets to be available to anonymous users, but not sure what the security implications are.

None.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13211].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Jira 6.4 instance is  responding slowly in many screens, with some screens showing timeouts.

h3. Environment
Large instance with many swimlanes or card colours configured for the Agile Kanban board

h3. Expected Results
It works with acceptable performance (20-30 sec). 

h3. Actual Results
It works slow (> 30 sec). 

h3. Notes

h4. Cause
Cause is boards with many swimlanes and card colours.

For every card colour or swimlane that is defined using JQL, the entire board query is run again, with the additional JQL appended. So if no swimlanes or card colours are defined and the board opens in N seconds, each swimlane or card colour defined is guaranteed to increase the load time by at least another N seconds. Given 5 swimlanes + 2 card colours + the actual board query, this board will take at least 8*N seconds to open.

2 Problems:
# For the customer's instance: "N" is large (lucene is not performant)
# We're running a lot of queries each time we display the board.

h3.Workaround
Remove swimlanes or card colours from the configuration.
Please check KB article: [Kanban board loading is slow - performance problems|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Kanban+board+loading+is+slow+-+performance+problems]
fields.summary: Slow Kanban response and performance after upgrade to Jira 6.4

fields.description:
Hello

h3. Feature suggestion
It would be great to have the ability to switch between different swimlanes on the fly, rather than having it being a board setting.

h3. Use case
As a scrummaster, I need to have a board where I can see the sprint with swimlanes based on stories, so I can quickly spot what subtasks remain for each story.

However for the daily scrum I need another board where swimlanes are based upon assignee. I had to create two boards, and each time I introduce a configuration change in one board, I have to copy it over to the other one.

h3. Conclusion
Other people or situation might also shed light on the need for other swimlanes, based upon the same board. Basically, to me, the swimlane should not be a hard coded setting in the board, but a quick filter that you can change any time depending on your current and ever changing need.
fields.summary: Ability to switch between multiple swimlanes configurations from the quickfilter area

fields.description:
I know you ask that I search before adding an issue. However, search is very liberal and not easily filtered and so my issues are rarely addressed by search returns. I am giving written feedback as a last ditch effort to get some help, and even finding this took upwards of 5 minutes (way too long for a feedback box).

My main issue is that documentation explains features from a development perspective, which doesn't serve me as I am a business user and would like features discussed more broadly so that I may relate them to my work.

Documentation is either very sparse or not tagged well because, like I said, searching hardly every addresses my needs. I am rarely able to use documentation to solve my problems, and the learning curve on this product is steep so I've spent several months just fumbling around trying to "figure it out." This product is so full of features and functional that it (and those who created it) deserve better documentation to help customers actually use and work with it. As things are, I use it sparingly because I never really know where to find things on a board designed for developers when I am in a very different business field. The features are also named and labeled using industry terms like "scrum," which means nothing to me and requires research before I can know to look for something else, which is often also not labeled in a straight-forward manner.

At the moment, I am trying to learn the differences between various project types (for about the 5th time; thought I understood, but somehow I am constantly finding new info that wasn't available before...) as well as how to delete or back up data, none of which simple searches have been able to explain.

I may not be developer-style computer savvy but I am no Luddite either, and this should be way easier. One good start would be to include a text box in the page-specific feedback area (instead of the multiple choice of three vague options). You'll get better page-specific feedback that may allow your teams to address needs better than via a separate task or suggestion that is now removed from its context... Another good place to start would be to consider that development language does not always translate across industries, and when you claim to address regular business needs, your help language should reflect that.

I'm sorry if this sounds harsh. I like the product overall; I'm just very frustrated that help is so hard to come by. I can't even call anyone...
fields.summary: Documentation Suggestions

fields.description:
If parent issue Sprint is changed, the information about this is displayed in the issue changelog and sub-task sprint is also updated, but for sub-task neither history or updated date reflect this change. 

eazyBI reporting plugin for JIRA is going through issue history to reflect Sprint changes for issues (including sub-tasks). In the case when sub-task Sprint is updated, eazyBI has no way of detecting what was the previous sprint or that the issue was updated at all (as the updated date is not changing for sub-task if it's Sprint is changed).

It would be necessary that sub-tasks are processed in the same way as other issues
* In case sub-task Sprint is changed, this information is reflected in sub-task changelog (history tab) the same way as for parent issue types
* sub-task updated date is changed when the Sprint of sub-task is updated
fields.summary: Sub-task issue does not reflect Sprint changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Loading time for Kanban board with default work _subfilter_ is longer. 
Default work _subfilter_ with *UnreleasedVersions()*:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{code}
Calls to {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json}} are more slow with default work _subfilter_. 

h3. Environment
* Instances with large number of Versions are affected, example: 10k+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Load board 

h3. Expected Results
Loading board doesn't degrade with number of version in other project (in whole JIRA)

h3. Actual Results
Loading board takes longer when there is a higher number of version in other project (in whole JIRA).
 
h3. Notes
See related KB: [Kanban board loading is slow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/kanban-board-loading-is-slow-performance-problems-800686285.html]

Some improvements have already been done in GHS-9611, JRA-38883, JRASERVER-62666 

h5. Original data from user 
Here are some system stats
{code}
Total versions: 23792
Of the total, 20616 are *unreleased*.

JIRA issues: 1.5 million
Projects: 660
{code}

Here's a before and after load time in seconds when we delete the work subfilter:
{code}
11.7050  https://jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json 
11.3350  https://jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json 

--- delete work subfilter ---

3.0680  https://jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json 
3.1440  https://jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json 
3.0290  https://jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json 
3.1320  https://jira/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json 
{code}

h3.Workaround
* Delete _Kanban board sub-filter_ if you don't need versions
* If you need version, add specific project(s) related to JQL filter for the board into *unreleasedVersions* function
{code:borderStyle=solid}
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions(ProjA, ProjB) OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{code}
fields.summary: UnreleasedVersions() is slow on large instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Update Parent Issue dialog will keep coming back until you hit cancel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Basic software development.
# Go to Jira Administration -> Issues -> Sub-tasks -> Add Sub-Task Issue Type and create two subtasks
# Go to Jira Administration -> Issues -> Issue type schemes, then move the created sub-tasks from Available Issue Types to Issue Types for Current Scheme and save
# Create a Knaban Board with Name "UpdateParentIssue" and choose a saved the filter with All Standard Issue Types are checked for that board 
# Create a Knaban Board with Name "Specification" and choose a saved the filter with Specification in the Sub-Task Issue Types are checked for that board 
# Create a Kanban Board with Name "Testing" and choose a saved the filter with Specification in the Sub-Task Issue Types are checked for that board 
# Create a Issue with "Task" as the issue type for the "UpdateParentIssue" project 
# Create two subtasks for the task above , one subtask with "Specification" as the issue type , another one subtask with "Testing" as the Issue Type
# Go to the Specification Board , when move one of the card from In Progress to Done column,  the Update Parent Issue dialog will appear saying "All sub-tasks for parent issue are now Done. Do you want to update this parent issue to match?"
This should not appear as there is still another sub-task exist in that board. (already raised a bug ticket for this at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-13188)
If you click on the Update button after that ,the Update Parent Issue dialog will keep coming back until you hit cancel. 

h3. Expected Results
The Update Parent Issue dialog should not keep coming back after you have clicked the Update button.

h3. Actual Results
Update Parent Issue dialog will keep coming back until you hit cancel.
fields.summary: Update Parent Issue dialog will keep coming back until you hit cancel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Update Parent Issue dialog will pop up with "All sub-tasks for parent issue are now Done" message even when there are still another sub-task that are not set to Done

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Basic software development.
# Go to Jira Administration -> Issues -> Sub-tasks -> Add Sub-Task Issue Type and create two subtasks
# Go to Jira Administration -> Issues -> Issue type schemes, then move the created sub-tasks from Available Issue Types to Issue Types for Current Scheme and save
# Create a Knaban Board with Name "UpdateParentIssue" and choose a saved the filter with All Standard Issue Types are checked for that board 
# Create a Knaban Board with Name "Specification" and choose a saved the filter with Specification in the Sub-Task Issue Types are checked for that board 
# Create a Kanban Board with Name "Testing" and choose a saved the filter with Specification in the Sub-Task Issue Types are checked for that board 
# Create a Issue with "Task" as the issue type for the "UpdateParentIssue" project 
# Create two subtasks for the task above , one subtask with "Specification" as the issue type , another one subtask with "Testing" as the Issue Type
# Go to the Specification Board , when move one of the card from In Progress to Done column,  the Update Parent Issue dialog will appear saying "All sub-tasks for parent issue are now Done. Do you want to update this parent issue to match?"
This should not appear as there is still another sub-task exist in that board.

h3. Expected Results

fields.description:
Would like the option for JIRA Administrators to be able to specify the default global kanban sub-filter used to seed new kanban boards.

The issue we're seeing is, people create a few boards for a Project and when one of them creates a Release to clear things from their board, it disappears from everyone else's board.  Additionally, if people create boards that span Projects which they may not be Admins in, they cannot create Releases in those Projects and thus get an error when they try to create a Release on their board.

So the current default sub-filter is sub-optimal for us and we'd like to change it to something like:

{code}resolution is EMPTY OR (resolution is not EMPTY AND resolved > -7d){code}

so as to have things drop off our Kanban board automatically after 7 days which is a more logical way to manage a Kanban board rather than having to constantly create Releases to clear it.  And we'd like the ability to make that the default so we don't have to constantly have users 'fix' their kanban boards.
fields.summary: Customize the global default kanban sub-filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Rank field in the LexoRank table is an concatenation of {{bucket(b)}} and {{rank(rrrr)}} of the form {{b|rrrrr}} where bucket is a {{0}}, {{1}},or {{2}}. During a rebalance the bucket is changed for all rows and so all database statistics are invalid and database optimisation planning is predictably destroyed.

This presents as performance problems during balancing operations, such as balance taking considerably long, and can also impact the performance of database querying on the LexoRank table, which is impacted when creating issues or any LexoRank operations that access the database rather than the indexes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Using a considerably large instance (500k+ issues), perform a balance operation.

h3. Expected Results

The balance completes in a suitable timeframe.

h3. Actual Results

Balances can take several days to complete.

h3. Workaround

Reducing the number of Rank fields to 1 is known to provide some performance improvements, as is upgrading to Agile 6.7.10 to fix [JSW-11491|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-11491]. Also if using SQL Server, the workaround in [JSW-12221|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-12221] may provide some performance improvements.

h3. Notes

For example, the query plan {{explain analyze SELECT * FROM public."AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = 10400 AND "RANK" LIKE '2|%' ORDER BY "RANK" DESC LIMIT 1;}}  looks like:
{panel:title="Before vacuum analyse"}
"Limit  (cost=137.89..137.89 rows=1 width=83) (actual time=1.661..1.661 rows=0 loops=1)"
"  ->  Sort  (cost=137.89..137.89 rows=1 width=83) (actual time=1.659..1.659 rows=0 loops=1)"
"        Sort Key: "RANK""
"        Sort Method: quicksort  Memory: 25kB"
"        ->  Seq Scan on "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"  (cost=0.00..137.88 rows=1 width=83) (actual time=1.623..1.623 rows=0 loops=1)"
"              Filter: ((("RANK")::text ~~ '1|%'::text) AND ("FIELD_ID" = 10400))"
"              Rows Removed by Filter: 4392"
"Planning time: 0.872 ms"
"Execution time: 1.706 ms"
{panel}
{panel:title="After vacuum analyse"}
"Limit  (cost=0.28..0.42 rows=1 width=83) (actual time=0.018..0.018 rows=1 loops=1)"
"  ->  Index Scan Backward using index_ao_60db71_lexorank_rank on "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK"  (cost=0.28..606.12 rows=4392 width=83) (actual time=0.017..0.017 rows=1 loops=1)"
"        Filter: ((("RANK")::text ~~ '2|%'::text) AND ("FIELD_ID" = 10400))"
"Planning time: 0.129 ms"
"Execution time: 0.040 ms"
{panel}

A proposed fix of splitting the rank into two separate columns, bucket and rank, should improve the database performance.
fields.summary: LexoRank database query performance is slow due to the way the field is constructed

fields.description:
A common set of questions that come up from our many Atlassian customers are related to what happens in the life of a sprint and what else is affected. I suggest creating a page in the documentation to answer these questions in one place together. The list of questions below are what people ask me.

h2. Create Sprint

How are issues with no estimate shown in the Backlog panel?

Why are estimates on sub-tasks not included in the Backlog panel?

h2. Start Sprint

What happens to issues that are added to the sprint after the sprint is started?

They are shown as a Scope Change in the Reports. Their estimates are not included in the reports.

What happens to issues whose estimate is changed after the sprint is started?

A snapshot of the issues in the sprint is taken to be used for the Sprint Report and Velocity Report. So changes to estimates do not appear in the reports.

Which reports show scope creep and how are those numbers calculated exactly?

h2. Close Sprint

Can I add an issue to a Closed sprint? 

Can I remove an issue from a Closed sprint?

Can I modify an issue's estimate after a sprint has been closed? Which reports are affected and which are not affected?
fields.summary: Document the key moments in a sprint and what they affect

The visibility of an Agile Board is based on the Board's Filter Permissions. To modify it, a user has to follow: [How to restrict the access to JIRA Agile Scrum board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-resources/jira-agile-faq/how-to-restrict-the-access-to-jira-agile-scrum-board]

*Problems:*
# There is no indication of the Filter governing the Visibility or Permissions of the Board on JIRA.
# If the Filter was created by another user, a copy of the filter has to be created and configured back on the Agile Board.

The Boards view shows the visibility:
!boards.jpeg|thumbnail! but no indication that the "Saved Filter" is the setting the permissions.

Clicking ... Configure takes you to the Boards General Configuration screen that reads:
{quote}
*General and filter*
The Board filter determines which issues appear on the board. It can be based on one or more projects, or custom JQL depending on your needs.
{quote} 
It doesn't mention Filter Permissions.
There are Project Permissions on that same screen that misleads. If a Board is assigned to 1 project, it would make sense that Board Visibility Permission would be on that section.


*Suggestion:* Simplify the Board Visibility configuration to make it more intuitive.

*Ideas:*
* Show a tooltip when Hoovering over the Visibility Restriction to show the Filter's Permissions.
* Add a note on the Board General Configuration
* Have a Edit Visibility option that would create a copy of the filter an allow Permission changes.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13138].
  {panel}

As a Greenhopper Scrum product owner, I want story estimates to automatically total to the sum of the estimates for all sub-tasks IF and ONLY IF subtasks are entered (else I want story estimates to be manual entry) so that I can view on the scrum board the original estimate against the remaining time.

Definition of Done:
1)  When no sub-tasks exist for a story, the estimate field for the story allows entry of a value manually
2)  When one or more sub-tasks exist for a story, the estimate field for the story is calculated as the sum of the estimates for all sub-tasks for that story

Context:

I'm finding a feature in Greenhopper to NOT operate as I would have expected. The feature is in estimating where the estimation on the scrum board is configured for original time estimates. What I would like is: 
1) when no sub-tasks are created for a story, the estimation and remaining fields are editable within the story 
2) when sub-tasks have been created, the story estimate and remaining fields are calculated as the sum of the estimate and remaining fields for the sub-tasks 

What's currently happening is that the story estimate field is not calculated from the sum of the sub-tasks but the story remaining field is. Worse, if you enter a value in the story estimate field when sub-tasks have been added and estimated, the value entered into the story estimate field is added to the story remaining field, which already has the sum of the sub-tasks. Thus, if, as a work around, you try to manually enter a story estimate that equals the sum of the sub-task estimates, the story remaining field value doubles. There's no work around for this. This feature seems poorly defined. I understand what the product team was trying to accomplish... the ability to estimate and view remaining values for stories that have no sub-tasks or prior to sub-tasks being added. What they missed is that the field could serve both functions - manual entry when no sub-tasks exist and calculated value when sub-tasks do exist. I strongly urge the product team to consider this feature at their earliest opportunity as the inability to see from the scrum board the original estimate against the remaining value in plan and work mode is a problem. 

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Configure Scrum board to use "Original Time Estimate" for Estimation Statistic
# Configure Scrum board to use "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" for Time Tracking
# Create an issue with issue type Story, without specifying any Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate
# Create 2 sub-tasks for this issue.
#* Sub-task 1 has Remaining Estimate of 4 hours
#* Sub-task 2 has Remaining Estimate of 2 hours
# Checking parent of sub-tasks in Issue View, Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate is now shown as 6 hours
# Navigate back to Scrum board, open Issue Detail View, and Original Estimate for parent issue is _Unestimated_
fields.summary: Sum estimates from sub-tasks in user stories

fields.description:
h4. +Scenario+
When the following conditions are met:
# project A and project B use the same workflow WF
# project A is managed in board A and project B is managed in board B
# the column mappings in board A and board B are the same
# project A and B are managed by the same admin

And the admin performs the following actions:
# edit workflow WF and add a new status S to it (and publish it)
# configure board A's columns and map status S to column C (any of the available columns)

h4. +Suggestion+
The following feature should be available:
# JIRA/Agile asks the admin if the same mapping should be done in board B (or any other boards detected to be using the same set of workflow and columns)
# the admin should be able to accept or reject this bulk update

h3. Summary

Inline issue creates issues in the Backlog in some specific environments as follows.

# There is more than one CF called "Sprint" defined
# Jira was installed with non English language
#* It actually means "Sprint" custom field was generated with the non English language (e.g. "スプリント" in Japanese)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create custom field called Sprint
# Create a board
# Create a future sprint
# Inline create an issue

h3. Expected Results

The issue is created in the future sprint.

h3. Actual Results

The issue appears in the backlog.

h4. Workaround

* If there is duplicate "Sprint" field, please just rename it (not the original one) to another name.
* If the original "Sprint" field was generated with non English language (e.g. "スプリント"), please rename it to "Sprint" with the following steps.
*# Unlock "スプリント" field with following [How to unlock a Locked Jira Software Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-unlock-a-locked-jira-software-field-779158866.html]
*# Rename "スプリント" field to "Sprint"
fields.summary: Inline issue creates issues in the Backlog

fields.description:
h5. +Steps to reproduce+
# create a new simple Scrum board
# create 2 Epics
# select Epic 1 and click Create Issue from Backlog -> Inline Create is available:
!epic1.png|thumbnail!
# immediately select Epic 2 and click Create Issue from Backlog

h5. +Expected behavior+
Inline Create is available as in the above screenshot

h5. +Actual behavior+
Nothing happens:
!epic2.png|thumbnail!

h5. +Notes+
This doesn't mean that something is wrong with Epic 2. The same behavior happens if Epic 2 is selected first and then Epic 1. In that case Inline Create is available for Epic 2 but not Epic 1.

(!) Literally it can be said that the feature takes turns to work when Epic switching is involved. For example, if there're 3 Epics, the scenario will be:
# select Epic 1 and click Create Issue -> Works
# select Epic 2 and click Create Issue -> Doesn't work
# select Epic 3 and click Create Issue -> Works
# select Epic 1 and click Create Issue -> Doesn't work (though it works before)
# select Epic 2 and click Create Issue -> Works (though it doesn't work before)
# ...
fields.summary: Inline Issue Creation does not work when switching from one Epic to another

fields.description:
Version: (v6.4.6#64021-sha1:33e5b45

With out latest upgrade to 6.4.6, Agile Scrum and Kanban boards which used to allow ranking now fail with the error stating that Ranking is disabled because the filter view is not ordered by rank ascending.

Turns out, the filter view was "Project in (MIR,MSAM) ORDER BY rank"

So I tried: "Project in (MIR,MSAM) ORDER BY rank asc"

and the ranking still failed.

I asked it to apply the ranking, and it changed the filter to "Project in (MIR,MSAM) ORDER BY Rank ASC" and the ranking of the boards now worked as expected.

I suspect that while the filter query is not case sensitive, the logic that checks for the filter "rank asc" when allowing ranking of boards is case sensitive. I propose that the logic that checks for the filter "rank asc" should use the same case sensitivity as the filter (i.e. should be case insensitive)

(specifically, this was a board that combined two projects, but I don't think that was the limitation).
fields.summary: Ranking disabled based on case sensitivity of the filter query

fields.description:
Problem Definition

This piece of documentation is confusing:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile063/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-a-board/using-report-mode/viewing-the-control-chart

It states in bold: "The control chart includes all issues that spent time in any of the selected columns and are no longer in any of the selected columns."

Suggested Solution

The better way to say it is:  “The control chart includes all issues that spent time in any of the selected columns.  The time the issue is currently spending in a column is not displayed even if that column is selected.”

This is due to if you go into a lane all of the historical lane changes will be shown in the control chart.  It at least implies that none of the historical data will be presented if in a selected column.

So say you have the following issue:

# Issue DL-1 has been created and in status Open at 12:00 Jan 1 2016
# Issue DL-1 Moves from status Open to status A at 12:00 Jan 2 2016
# Issue DL-1 Moves from status A to status B at 12:00 Jan 3 2016
# Issue DL-1 moves from status B to status C at 12:00 Jan 4 2016

The statement in the current document suggests that the graph will not render the status A or B.  The graph will render this.  Also if DL-1 moves back to status B then to status C, the first time DL-1 was in status C will be rendered.
fields.summary: Control chart documentation confusing
